column4: does anyone know how to take all the free space on a ntfs partition and turning that into an ext3 partition for linux
iirc gparted can mostly do this (shrink the partition, then create a new one in the free space)
as long as you can oot off that hd: just like you'd install it on a regular hd
just pay attention when you reach the partitioning step (make sure the partitions end up on the right drive)
